popped the jump rope part right off the carrots okay then I took the carrot and
opened up the end with an exacto knife be very careful with this you know
especially these sharp instruments just twist it until I got a hole that the

through the other carrot so I got them facing each other the bottoms of the

wanted to have some embellishment on this so I did is I got these I have

and then I wanted some grain on the bottom to hold this up so I got a couple
washers one is a two inch washer and the other one is an inch and a quarter
washer and I figured this would be enough weight to help hold this up and
so I glued the two washers together then what I did is I got a piece of aluminum
foil and glued that on the two washers with a hot glue now be very careful
because the aluminum foil will conduct a heat from the hot glue so don't burn
yourself and once I got that on I just got you know closed up any loose edges
or anything on it with the hot glue and nature was securely glued to the
base then I started adding glue to the two carrots so I added glue between on
the stick between the two carrots is drag the hot glue gun between the two
you want to get a natural kind of rock formation look and then what I did was I
took the hot glue gun and dragged it along the carrot so I'd squirt some hot
glue at the length of the carrot and then drag it up and down and that gave

gave him more of our stone look okay so once that was done I glued the first
